source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第三十五
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 35

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏闍那崛多譯
translation: Sui Tianzhu Tripiṭaka Jñānagupta Translation

source_sentence: 耶輸陀因緣品下
translation: Second Chapter of Yaśodhar's Causes and Conditions

source_sentence: 「爾時善覺大富長者，以諸親族數數慇懃共相曉喻，乃至第三，苦切勸諫，而彼長者意中不已，即將家僮，齎持大斧、簸箕杴鋤，及諸鍬钁、種種刀鋸，詣彼樹所，既到彼已，立於樹前而作是言：『汝樹當知！
translation: "It was then that the well-appreciated wealthy elder, who had been repeatedly and diligently discoursed with his relatives up to the third degree, and who had earnestly urged them to stop, took his household staff with him, carrying a large axe, a winnowing basket, a hoe, a shovel, and various swords and saws, and went to the tree.

source_sentence: 我從他聞，汝是神樹，名所求願一切皆得，若有人來求乞男女，悉皆果遂，而我無有一箇兒息，心內願樂，而不稱可。
translation: I've heard from others that you're a sacred tree whose name says that whatever you wish for, it's obtained, and if someone comes begging for a man or woman, they all get it, but I don't have a single child to rest on, and I wish for happiness within my heart, but I don't think it's possible.

source_sentence: 今從汝乞，若令我得生於好男，我當來作如是供養，作是報答。
translation: Now, if I were to beg from you, and if you were to allow me to be born a good son, I would come and make such offerings and make such rewards.

source_sentence: 必汝不能與我子者，我當將此大斧鍬钁，斫掘汝樹，根本枝條，一切悉却，終不放汝。
translation: If you can't give me a son, I will chop down your tree with this large axe, shovel, and shovel, digging up all its roots and branches, and I will never let you go.

source_sentence: 乃至令如馬藺根鬚，而留殘著，若掘到地，取汝根莖，叚叚斫斷，取汝枝柯，片片剉切，斫截割已，札札曬乾訖已，持火燒汝作灰；如灰塵已，或將汝灰，臨急疾河，向水而擲，或將汝灰，對猛大風，吹令四散。』
translation: Even if I were to dig into the ground, take your roots and stems, chop them up, take your branches and twigs, shave them in pieces, chop them off, dry them up in the sun, hold a fire, and burn them as ashes; after they are ashes, I might toss your ashes into a fast-flowing river, or I might toss your ashes into a violent wind that would scatter them.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼樹有神依之，神聞此語生大恐怖，憂惱不歡，又作是念：『我實不與他作男女，但人來者，自有業因，自有福力，而得男女。
translation: "At the time, there was a spirit in that tree depending on him, and when the spirit heard this, he became terrified and upset, and he thought, 'I really don't make men and women with other people, but people who come have their own causes of action and their own powers of merit, and they become men and women.'

source_sentence: 而彼等人，謂言此樹能與男女，既得願已，然後來報此樹之恩。』
translation: Those people say that this tree can give them male and female, and after they obtain their wish, then they come to repay the tree's kindness.'

source_sentence: 而彼樹神，悲泣流淚，作如是言：『此我生來所居之樹，以彼長者不得子故，其必當壞毀我此樹。』
translation: That tree god wept and shed tears as he said, 'This tree where I was born will surely destroy this tree of mine because that elder can't have children.'

source_sentence: 而彼樹神，於帝釋天，恒常承事。
translation: That tree god is always in constant service to Śakra Devānām-Indra.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼神速疾往詣天主帝釋忉利天宮，到已長跪白帝釋天，作如是言：『依前長者求乞兒子得不禍福善惡之語，大善天王！
translation: "At the time, that god quickly went to the palace of Indra, the lord of the gods, and when he arrived, he knelt down and said to Indra, "Thus did the elder beg for a son who will not be harmed by good or bad words, O great good king of gods!

source_sentence: 唯願大天巧慧方便，早作如是精勤速疾，與彼長者端正之男，勿令於我此樹磨滅。』
translation: Please let the great gods skillfully and wisely work together to give this kind of effort early and quickly to that elderly, upright man, so that this tree of mine doesn't perish.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，天主帝釋大王告樹神曰：『汝之樹神！
translation: "At that point, the lord of the gods, Indra the Great, addressed the tree gods, saying, 'Your tree gods!

source_sentence: 勿作是語。
translation: "Don't say that.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 今我亦復不能為於世間之人定與男女，但諸人輩自有福因而得男女。
translation: "Again, I can't predestine men and women for people in the world, but it's the merit of all people to obtain men and women.

source_sentence: 其理雖然，汝之樹神！
translation: Although that's true, you tree god!

source_sentence: 少忍耐看，莫生憂惱，我當觀察彼之長者有因緣不？』
translation: With little patience, don't become sad; will I observe whether that elder has a cause?"

source_sentence: 時忉利天有一天子，五衰相現，不久定當墮落世間。
translation: At the time, there was a god in the Heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials who showed signs of five signs of decay and would surely fall into the world soon.

source_sentence: 五衰相何？
translation: What are the five signs of decay?

source_sentence: 一者彼天頭上妙花，忽然萎黃；二者彼天，自身腋下，汗汁流出；三者彼天，所著衣裳，垢膩不淨；四者彼天，身體威光，自然變改；五者彼天，常所居停，微妙寶床，忽然不樂，東西移徙。
translation: One, that god suddenly has a marvelous flower on his head that withers yellow; two, that god has sweat dripping from his armpits; three, that god has clothing that's dirty and impure; four, that god's body has a radiant appearance that naturally changes; and five, that god's fine jeweled bed where he always resides suddenly becomes unhappy and migrates east and west.

source_sentence: 「爾時，天主釋提桓因語彼天子，作如是言：『善汝天子！
translation: "At the time, the lord Śakra Devānām-Indra said to that celestial, "Good, you celestials!

source_sentence: 若知時者，汝有善緣，植眾善本，常不放逸，謹慎畏罪，無諸過患，不造諸非，又復未曾作重惡業，直以嫉妬，汝今應當退失此處，必生人間於一善處。』
translation: If you knew then that you had good causes, planted many good roots, were never careless, were careful of sins, had no faults, and didn't do anything wrong, and had never done heavy bad actions or been straightforwardly jealous, you would retire from this place and surely be born in a good place.'

source_sentence: 「爾時天子白帝釋言：『願聞其處。』
translation: "It was then that the gods said to Tīrṣa, 'I wish to hear about their location.'

source_sentence: 帝釋報言：『今此下方閻浮提地，有一大城名波羅[木*奈]，而彼城有一大長者名曰善覺，彼長者家，大富饒財，多有勢力，乃至一切無所乏少，而彼無子。
translation: Tissadatta replied, 'Now, down here in the land of Jambudvīpa, there's a large city named Pola[mu*nai], and in that city there's a large elder named Sunkaku whose family is very wealthy and powerful, so much so that there's nothing lacking, but he has no children.

source_sentence: 汝今發心，往波羅[木*奈]，為彼作兒。』
translation: Now, you must resolve to go to [Mokṣala*Nāga] and be a son for him.'

source_sentence: 「時是天子，於過去世得天子身，種諸善根，而作生死解脫因緣，面向涅槃，背於煩惱，不取諸有，不愛一切有為中生，而彼一生，欲取漏盡，欲證聖道。
translation: "That prince of a god attained the status of prince in a past life, planted good roots, created causes for liberation from birth-and-death, headed for nirvāṇa, turned his back on affliction, didn't acquire existences, and didn't crave all birth in the midst of existences, but in his lifetime, he wanted to end the contaminants and realize the noble path.

source_sentence: 而彼天子諮帝釋言：『大善天王！
translation: That celestial consults Śakra and says, 'Great, good king of gods!

source_sentence: 我今不欲處在居家以受世樂。
translation: "Now, I don't want to live at home and experience worldly pleasures.

source_sentence: 「『又復，護明菩薩大士，不久從彼兜率天下，降神生於迦毘羅城釋種姓內，淨飯王宮，大夫人邊，右脇入胎，月滿而生。
translation: "'Furthermore, it won't be long before the great luminous protector Bodhisattva descends from that Tuṣita Heaven and sends down a spirit to be born inside the city of Kapilavastu, near the palace of King Jōtan and the great lady, where he enters the womb on his right side and is born when the moon is full.

source_sentence: 生已棄捨王位出家，當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，成已當轉無上法輪。
translation: After he's born, he'll renounce the position of king and leave home, where he'll achieve unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma after achieving it.

source_sentence: 我意欲於彼菩薩邊修行梵行。
translation: I want to train in the religious practice at the side of that bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 而彼長者，居家大有資財珍寶，多諸勢力，乃至一切種種豐饒，而其彼家放逸之處，我意不願向彼而生。』
translation: But I don't want to go to that elder's house, which is full of wealth, possessions, treasures, power, and all kinds of abundance, and which is a place of dissipation.

source_sentence: 「爾時，天主帝釋大王語彼天子作如是言：『汝但乞願求生彼家，護明菩薩不久當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，成已當轉無上法輪。
translation: "At the time, the lord of the gods, Indra the Great, said to that celestial, 'Just ask for permission to be born in that home, and it won't be long before the guarded bodhisattva achieves unsurpassed, correct enlightenment and turns the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma after achieving it.

source_sentence: 我於彼時，自當成就汝出家緣，亦助佐汝出家之事。』
translation: At that point, I myself will fulfill the requirements for your leaving home and assist you in leaving home.'

source_sentence: 時彼天子報帝釋言：『善哉天王！
translation: The celestial then answered Tīrṣa, 'Good, O king of gods!

source_sentence: 若於彼時，王能如是佐助於我發心因緣，令得成就，當生彼家。』
translation: If the king thus assists me in the causes and conditions of my aspiration and makes it possible, I will be born in his household.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，天主帝釋大王報彼尼拘陀樹神言：『汝善樹神！
translation: "At that point, the lord of the gods, Indra the Great, reported to the Nirgrantha tree god, saying, 'You good tree god!

source_sentence: 若知時者，汝當速報彼長者知，而語之言：「善哉長者！
translation: If you know the time, you must quickly report it to that elder's knowledge and say, "Good, sir!

source_sentence: 汝所乞願，不久當生端正之子。
translation: You've begged that soon you will give birth to a correct son.

source_sentence: 生已不久捨家出家，當作沙門。」』
translation: Soon after he's born, he'll leave home and renounce the world as an ascetic."

source_sentence: 「爾時，樹神從帝釋邊聞此語已，心大歡喜，踊躍充遍，不能自勝。
translation: "After hearing these words from the side of Tīrṣa, the tree god was greatly elated and filled with joy, unable to contain himself.

source_sentence: 速往詣彼大長者家，到已在空，隱身不現，語長者言：『大善長者！
translation: He quickly went to that great elder's house, and when he arrived, he withdrew into space, saying to the elder, 'Great, good elder!

source_sentence: 汝必當生智慧端正福德之子，但其生己，不久定應捨家出家而作沙門。』
translation: You will surely give birth to a wise, upright, and virtuous son, but he will surely leave home and become a monk soon after being born himself.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，長者報樹神言：『善哉天神！
translation: "At that point, the elder reported to the tree god, saying, 'Good, gods!

source_sentence: 但願我生，我當方便不令捨家而作沙門。』
translation: 'May I be born, and I will make it easy for you not to abandon your home and become a monk.'

source_sentence: 時彼天子，從忉利天，墮落下來，與大長者婦腹受胎，既受胎已，彼婦即覺語長者言：『大善長者！
translation: That child of the gods then fell down from the Heaven of Thirty-three and was conceived in the womb of a great elder woman.

source_sentence: 應須歡喜，我已受胎。』
translation: Rejoice, for I have been conceived.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，長者聞是語已，即為其婦立於最上將息之法，最上敷設，最上莊嚴，最上供承，最上飲食，最上服飾，而供給之，令其玩弄。
translation: "After hearing these words, the elder then set up for his wife the most excellent method of calming, the most elaborate, the most adorned, the most supportive, the most delicious, and the most adorned, and he offered it to her for her to play with.

source_sentence: 「爾時，長者於波羅[木*奈]四城門外，衢道陌頭多人處所，立無遮會，有來索者，求食與食，須飲與飲，欲鬘與鬘，索香與香，或須塗香，即與塗香。
translation: "At the time, the elder set up an uncrowded meeting outside the gates of the four cities of Pola [munai], along the roads and in many places, where people came to ask for food to eat, drink to drink, garlands to wear, incense to wear, or fragrances to apply.

source_sentence: 須床敷者，即與床敷，須資生者，悉具與之。
translation: Those who need a bed to lay out will be given a bed to lay out, and those who need provisions for living will be given them all.

source_sentence: 時其家內所有財物，皆收內庫，一切酒坊，一切屠舍，並皆除斷。
translation: All the belongings of his household were then put into the inner treasury, and all the wine shops and all the slaughterhouses were removed.

source_sentence: 「時長者婦，或滿九月，或滿十月，其胎成熟，產一男兒，極大端正，可喜少雙，身體色黃，猶如金柱，頭頂團圓，猶如傘蓋，鼻如鸚鵡，長臂下垂，支節端直，諸根悉具，肌肉柔和，猶生酥摶。
translation: "When an elderly woman's womb matures, whether after the ninth or tenth month, she gives birth to a male child, very large and correct, pleasant to be around, with a body yellow in color like a pillar of gold, a head that's rounded like an umbrella, a nose like a parrot, long arms that hang down, limbs that are straight, and all of his faculties are present, and his muscles are soft like butter fingers.

source_sentence: 彼子生已，其上自然化出微妙七寶之蓋，而諸世人所見之者，皆大唱言：『希有！
translation: After the child is born, a canopy of subtle seven treasures naturally appears from his head, and people who see it all cry out, 'Rare!'

source_sentence: 昔來未曾覩見。』
translation: I've never seen it before.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，長者為彼童子立四乳母：一者抱持，二者洗浴，三者與乳，四者共戲。
translation: "At the time, the elder created four nursemothers for the boy: one to carry him, two to bathe him, three to nurse him, and four to play with him.

source_sentence: 童子生後，長者恒於四城門外及交道頭，立無遮會，如前所設。
translation: After the boy was born, the elder always set up an assembly without obstructions outside the four gates of the city and at the head of the intersection, just as he had done before.

source_sentence: 又復集聚內外眷屬，而語之言：『我今已生如是兒子，汝等立名。』
translation: He also gathers his inner and outer retinue and says, 'Now that such a son has been born to me, you must name him.'

source_sentence: 其眷屬等，相共平量，此子初生，上有寶蓋，自然出現，以是因緣，名聞流布，遍於一切，是故此子，應名上傘。
translation: Their dependents all equally estimated that when this son was first born, he had a jeweled canopy over him that naturally appeared, and because of this cause and condition, fame and reputation spread throughout the world, so this son should be called the Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 於是後人相共稱喚，為耶輸陀(耶輸陀者隋言上傘)。
translation: Subsequently, people called him Yaśodhar (Yaśodhar is the Sui word for superior umbrella).

source_sentence: 其耶輸陀，於父母邊，唯止一子，父母愛念，不曾離心，眼欲恒看，目前養育，令其增長易觀易畜。
translation: That boy Yaśodhar, who had only one child near his parents, was loved by his parents, never departed from them, and whose eyes wanted to look at him constantly, nourished him so that he would grow up to be easy to observe and easy to store.

source_sentence: 而有偈說：「『福德之人疾增長，　　猶如良地蒔菓栽，　　薄運少祐無相人，　　似於道頭種諸樹。』
translation: There's a verse that says, 'A man of virtue quickly grows, just like a good plot of ground planted with fruit, and a weak-luck, little-success, markless man, just like trees planted at the head of the road.'

source_sentence: 「而彼童子，漸漸長成，既能行走，後依家法，教諸技能，使學作業，所謂書算，及造印記。
translation: "That boy gradually grows up and is able to walk, and then he relies on his family's teaching methods to teach skills and make them work, such as writing and arithmetic and making seals.

source_sentence: 出財與他，從外受入，貨易興販，染諸色繒，衣服裁縫，別諸香類，識達五穀，了別七珍及諸寶物。
translation: He gives away his wealth to others, takes in from the outside, makes goods readily available, dyes silks, tailors clothes, distinguishes fragrances, comprehends grains, and discerns seven treasures and other precious things.

source_sentence: 諸如是等，一切皆練，無不洞曉，工巧辯捷，利智聰明，悉皆成就，無人與等。
translation: All of these things are well-honed, nothing they don't understand, their skills and abilities are excellent, and their sharp intelligence is fully developed like no other.

source_sentence: 及至年大，欲遣別停。
translation: When they reach the age of majority, they want to be sent away for a special stop.

source_sentence: 「爾時，其父為彼童子，造立三堂：一擬冬坐，二擬春秋兩時而坐，三擬夏坐。
translation: "At the time, his father built three halls for the boy: one for sitting in winter, two for sitting in spring and autumn, and three for sitting in summer.

source_sentence: 擬冬坐堂，一向溫煖；擬夏坐者，一向風涼；擬於春秋二時坐者，不熱不寒，調和處中。
translation: The hall intended for winter sitting is always warm and inviting, the hall intended for summer sitting is always breezy and cool, and the hall intended for spring and autumn sitting is neither hot nor cold and is in a harmonious place.

source_sentence: 其三堂內，所有器服，皆是眾寶之所雜成，所有飲食，最美最甘，心所樂見。
translation: In those three halls, all the wares and clothing are made from a mixture of many treasures, and all the food and drink are the most beautiful and delicious that the mind wants to see.

source_sentence: 其諸衣服，種種莊嚴，復以眾雜末香塗香，種種安置，立諸婇女，端正可憙，使相娛樂，於其宮內，堂殿前立種種階道，一一階道，有五百人，擎五百寶案，日初出時，則便安施，日沒已後，還擎收却。
translation: They are adorned with various kinds of clothing, perfumed with various kinds of powdered incense, placed in various ways, and composed of women who are correct, attractive, and entertain each other. Inside their palace, various steps are set up in front of the halls, and on each step there are five hundred people carrying five hundred treasure baskets, which are then placed in place when the sun first rises and put away after the sun goes down.

source_sentence: 「其堂周匝，有五百人防護守視，身體皆著牢固鎧甲，手執刀棒，或持鐵輪三叉戟等，以用擬備；其三等堂，各各如是。
translation: "Around the hall, there are five hundred men guarding and watching over it, each wearing a strong suit of armor and carrying a sword and bludgeon or an iron wheel and trident for preparation; each of the three halls is likewise.

source_sentence: 畏耶輸陀童子忽然捨棄出家，其堂內外，門戶關鑰，皆悉牢固，其彼諸門開閉之聲，聞半由旬。
translation: Fearing that the boy Yaśodhar had suddenly abandoned his home, the doors and gates of his hall were all securely shut, both inside and outside, and the sound of those doors opening and closing was heard for half a leap.

source_sentence: 「時，耶輸陀在彼堂殿，具足而受五欲快樂，逍遙嬉戲。
translation: "At the time, Yaśodhar was in that hall, fully enjoying the five pleasures and playing freely.

source_sentence: 于時世尊，在波羅[木*奈]初轉無上法輪之後，帝釋天王從天上下，至耶輸陀宮殿之中，到已發覺耶輸陀言：『仁耶輸陀！
translation: After the Bhagavān first turned the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma at Bālā [muna], Indra the king of gods descended from heaven and went to Yaśodhar's palace, and when he arrived, he found Yaśodhar and said, 'Ren Yaśodhar!

source_sentence: 仁今時至，必應不久捨家出家。』
translation: 'Your arrival now will surely lead to your renunciation of the house and leaving home soon.'

source_sentence: 時，耶輸陀聞帝釋天如是言已，嘿然而受。
translation: After hearing this from Śakra Devānām-Indra, Yaśodhar accepted it with reverence.

source_sentence: 既默受已，天曉之時，索駟馬車，欲往園中觀看善地。
translation: After he had accepted them in silence, he gathered a carriage at dawn and wanted to go to the garden to look at the good ground.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊於晨朝時，著衣持鉢安庠而入波羅[木*奈]城欲乞於食，即以長老阿奢踰時用為侍者。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān gathered his robe and bowl in the morning and entered the city of Pola [munai] in order to solicit alms, using the elder Āśaya as his attendant.

source_sentence: 其耶輸陀，遙見如來向前而來，威儀端正，行步沈審，身體具足，諸相莊嚴，猶如虛空，滿於星宿。
translation: He, Yaśodhar, saw the Tathāgata coming forward from a distance, his manner was correct, his walk was deliberate, and his body was fully proportioned and adorned with features like the sky filled with stars.

source_sentence: 見已心生歡喜清淨，以內歡喜清淨之心，從車而下頂禮佛足，圍遶三匝，遶已還上車中而行。
translation: After he saw that, his heart became joyous and pure, and with a joyous and pure heart, he descended from the chariot, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, circled him three times, and returned to the chariot after circling him and walked.

source_sentence: 其耶輸陀，見於如來迴還未久，時佛知彼清淨之心，即便微笑，放於光明。
translation: When he saw that, Yaśodhar hadn't been able to return for long, the Buddha knew of his pure heart and even smiled, emitting his radiance.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老阿奢踰時整衣而立，偏袒右肩，右膝著地，合十指掌，向於如來，而白佛言：『希有世尊！
translation: At the time, the elder Āśānya then adjusted his robes, bared his right shoulder, knelt on his right knee, put his palms together with his ten fingers, faced the Tathāgata, and said to him, 'It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何因緣故？
translation: What are the causes and conditions?

source_sentence: 微笑放光。』
translation: A smile radiates his light.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告阿奢踰時，作如是言：『汝比丘！
translation: "It was then that the Buddha addressed Āśānya and said, 'You monks!

source_sentence: 見此耶輸陀童子以不？』
translation: Did you see this boy Yaśodhar?"

source_sentence: 其至我邊，頂禮於我，三匝遶我，還退上車。
translation: When he reached me, he paid homage to me, circled me three times, and returned to his chariot.

source_sentence: 阿奢踰時即白佛言：『唯然世尊！
translation: Āśānya then said to the Buddha, 'Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我向已見。』
translation: I've seen it before.'

source_sentence: 佛復告言：『汝今諦聽！
translation: Again, the Buddha told them, 'Now listen closely!

source_sentence: 此耶輸陀大善男子！
translation: This great, good man Yaśodhar!

source_sentence: 今夜決定捨家出家，至於我邊，乞作沙門，作沙門已，不久而得阿羅漢果。』
translation: Tonight, he decided to leave home and renounce the world and come to me, begging to become an ascetic, and after becoming an ascetic, he'll soon attain the fruit of the arhat.'

source_sentence: 「時耶輸陀至園苑內，觀於善地，次第經行。
translation: "Yehuda then went into the garden, observed the good stages, and went through the steps in sequence.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋，以神通力，即化作一死婦女屍，其身膖脹，將欲爛壞，蠅蛆雜蟲，處處唼食。
translation: Then, by using his supernormal powers, Indra transformed himself into the corpse of a dead woman, whose body was corpulent and about to rot, and which was gobbled up by flies and maggots and worms.

source_sentence: 時，耶輸陀見彼死屍如是臭爛，見已心生污癩之想，而自念言：『是臭爛身，有何可樂生於著心，而自放逸？
translation: Seeing that dead corpse smelling and rotting like that, Yaśodhar's mind became defiled and he thought to himself, 'What's the pleasure of getting attached to this smelly, rotting body and letting it escape?'

source_sentence: 復於此中，生於樂想？
translation: And in this, does he give rise to pleasant thoughts?

source_sentence: 今已膿爛。』
translation: Now it's pus and rotten.'

source_sentence: 即口唱言：『我今不樂臭穢樂也。』
translation: He then said, 'Now, I don't like smelling bad and being disgusted.'

source_sentence: 欲還至家。
translation: He wanted to go back home.

source_sentence: 而彼童子，從苑內出還入己堂，而彼在初夜欲眠睡時，天帝釋以神通力，令諸婇女悉皆著睡，而其家內，處處然燈，猶如臂大，堂堂盡照，令明不斷。
translation: When that boy left the courtyard and returned to his own hall, at the beginning of the night when he wanted to go to sleep, Indra used his supernormal powers to cause all the women to fall asleep, and in his house there were lamps everywhere like arms so large that they shone completely from hall to hall, making their light continuous.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊當於彼夜作如是念：『今夜之中，其耶輸陀大善男子，決定勇猛，捨家出家，求作沙門。』
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān had this thought during that night: 'This night, that great good man Yaśodhar decided to be courageous, leave home, and seek to become an ascetic.'

source_sentence: 如是念已，至於一河，名波羅那(隋言斷除)，渡至彼岸，自取草鋪，既鋪草已，結加趺坐，欲一夜眠，心為慈愍其耶輸陀善男子故。
translation: After this thought, he reached a river named Paranirmita-vaśavartin, forded it, took his own straw, spread out his straw, sat cross-legged, and wanted to sleep for the night, because he had compassion for that good man Yaśodhar.

source_sentence: 「時，耶輸陀正著睡眠，自然忽覺，而見堂內，處處安置臂許燈明，見諸婇女悉著睡眠。
translation: "Yehuda was asleep when he suddenly became naturally aware and saw a lamp placed near his arm in his hall, and he saw his women all asleep.

source_sentence: 或有婇女，頸懸小鼓，或有婇女，挾於琵琶，或有婇女，挾於五絃，或有婇女抱持箜篌，或有婇女，以臂抱鼓，或有婇女，手執簫笛諸音聲等。
translation: There might be a woman with a snare drum around her neck, a woman with a lute, a woman with five strings, a woman with a harp, a woman with a drum in her arm, or a woman with a flute and other sounds in her hand.

source_sentence: 或有婇女，露於半身，喘息而眠；或有婇女，頭髻解散，傾側而眠；或有婇女，流於涕唾不淨而眠；或有婇女，口齒相齩，作聲而眠；或有婇女覆面而眠；或有婇女仰面而眠。
translation: Some Hakuba women sleep with their heads half exposed, gasping for breath; some women sleep with their heads untucked and tilted to their sides; some women sleep with tears and impure saliva; some women sleep with their mouths and teeth agitated, making noises; some women sleep with their faces covered; and some women sleep with their heads upturned.

source_sentence: 其耶輸陀，見於堂內諸婇女眠如是滿地，猶若死屍，一種無異。
translation: He, Yaśodhar, sees the women in the hall sleeping like this all over the floor, just like dead corpses, one kind and not different.

source_sentence: 見已即生厭離之想，生大患想，心中樂欲求涅槃想，心欲建立向涅槃想。
translation: After seeing that, he becomes disillusioned with it, gives rise to thoughts of great distress, has a desire in his mind to seek nirvāṇa, and wants to establish a mental attitude that leads to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 而作是念：『謂此大是恐怖之處！
translation: They then think, 'This is a great place of terror!'

source_sentence: 咄此大是擾亂不安怨嫌之處！』
translation: Duh, this is a great source of disruption and anxiety!'

source_sentence: 時耶輸陀如是見已，從其臥床忽然而起，脚著革屣，眾寶所成，論其價直，足二百千，著已意念，從堂欲下，至堂基邊，而無階道。
translation: After he saw this, Yaśodhar suddenly rose from his bed, put his feet in leather sandals made of various treasures, and talked about the value and straightness of those two hundred thousand feet.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋，即將階道立著其前，身放光明，而此光明普照其家。
translation: Tiṣya then placed the steps in front of him, emitted a bright light, and that light shone universally in his home.

source_sentence: 「時耶輸陀見此明已，從堂而出，漸至父宮諸婇女邊，到已見父所臥堂內，用好香油，以為燈明，其炷如臂，迴地及柱，處處皆安。
translation: "When he saw this light, Yaśodhar left the hall and went out gradually to his father's palace and the women there. When he arrived, he saw his father lying in the hall, using good scented oil to make a lamp with a wick like an arm, and it was placed everywhere around the ground and on a pillar.

source_sentence: 見諸婇女，皆著睡眠，懸抱樂器乃至如上，猶如死人在屍陀林，見已生於厭離之想，乃至生於極大恐怖。
translation: Seeing the women all tucked up in sleep, hanging instruments up to the level above, like a dead person in a cemetery, they gave rise to thoughts of disgust and even to great fear after seeing them.

source_sentence: 「時，耶輸陀從父堂出，漸至外門，見外門關，鑰鏁甚牢。
translation: "Yehuda then left his father's hall and gradually went to the outer gate, where he saw that the outer gate was securely locked.

source_sentence: 而開門時，其聲遠徹聞半由旬。
translation: When he opened the door, its sound was heard half a leap away.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋速疾開門，隱沒彼門不令作聲，畏耶輸陀出家之時有諸障礙。
translation: Indra then quickly opened the door and concealed it from the sound, fearing that there would be some obstruction when Yesodhar left home.

source_sentence: 「時耶輸陀從家出已，至大城門，其門名跋陀羅婆提(隋言賢主)。
translation: "After he left home, Yaśodhar went to the gate of a large city named Bhadrapati (Sui word for lord of goodness).

source_sentence: 既到於彼賢主城門，其門關閉門關甚牢，聲音遠聞，亦半由旬。
translation: When he arrived at the gate of that city of Bhadrapāla, it was so securely shut that its sound was heard as far away as half a leap.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋，一念之頃開於彼門，又隱彼聲不令他聞。
translation: In a moment's thought, then, the god Indra opened the gate there and hid the sound from others.

source_sentence: 心如是念：『勿令有人障耶輸陀出家因緣。』
translation: He thought, 'Don't let anyone obstruct the cause for Yaśodhar's leaving home.'

source_sentence: 「時，耶輸陀從城門出，漸漸至於波羅那河。
translation: "At the time, Yaśodhar left the city gate and gradually reached the Paranirmita River.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼河水忽暴漲，彌岸平滿，一切諸鳥，平頭而飲。
translation: At the time, the river suddenly swelled up so much that its banks were flat and full, and all the birds drank from it with their heads even.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋，即便隱滅彼之光明。
translation: Even then, the god Indra withdrew and extinguished his light.

source_sentence: 時耶輸陀至河此岸，即便停住，而口中唱：『謂此大患，咄大恐怖！』
translation: Yehuda then reached this bank of the river and even stopped, saying, 'This is a great danger, how terrifying!'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊在河彼岸露地經行。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān was walking in the open ground on the other side of the river.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊為憐愍彼耶輸陀故，身放光明，以金色臂，展手而向耶輸陀邊，作如是言：『善來善來！
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān, out of pity for that boy Yaśodhar, radiated a bright light from his body, spread his golden arms, and extended his hands to Yaśodhar's side, saying, 'Well done, well done!

source_sentence: 汝耶輸陀！
translation: Ruyah śūdra!

source_sentence: 此處無患，此處無畏，此處安樂，此處自在。』
translation: Here's no trouble, here's no fear, here's comfort, and here's freedom.'

source_sentence: 而有偈說：「『如來既見彼心已，　　而口呼唱如是言：　「汝來汝來耶輸陀，　　取此無畏涅槃路。」
translation: And there's a verse that says, "After the Tathāgata saw their minds, he called out to them, saying, 'Come, you, Yehuda, take this fearless path to nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 世尊無所而不見，　　世尊無所而不知，　　是故能知於彼心，　　故言世尊諸明具。』
translation: There's nothing the Bhagavān doesn't see, and nothing the Bhagavān doesn't know; therefore, he can know that mind, and that's why he says the Bhagavān's insights are complete.'

source_sentence: 「時，耶輸陀聞於世尊如是語已，即免一切心諸憂苦，即得心定。
translation: "After hearing the Bhagavān say that, Yaśodhar was freed from all mental misery and attained mental equipoise.

source_sentence: 譬如有人後春行路，被諸熱惱，疲極飢渴，忽值一池，其水涼冷，入於其內，澡洗飲水，除滅一切熱惱諸苦。
translation: It's like a person traveling in late spring who's troubled by heat, exhausted, and hungry, and then suddenly meets a pond whose water is cool and cold, enters it, washes himself, and drinks the water, which removes all the heat and suffering.

source_sentence: 如是如是，其耶輸陀大善男子，聞佛如是安慰言已，即滅一切諸心憂惱，心得寂定。
translation: Thus and so, after hearing such comforting words from the Buddha, that great good man Yaśodhar ceased all mental distress and attained calm concentration.

source_sentence: 「時，耶輸陀大善男子，心生歡喜，踊躍無量，遍滿其體，不能自勝。
translation: "At that point, that great good man Yaśodhar's heart became joyous and leaped incalculably, filling his body with joy that was beyond his control.

source_sentence: 脫彼眾寶所成革屣直二百千，棄已步入波羅那河。
translation: He stripped himself of the leather sandals made from those many treasures, reaching 2,000, and after discarding them, he stepped into the Vārāṇasī River.

source_sentence: 譬如有人捨於涕唾，無復心念即背而行。
translation: It's like a person who discards tears and spittle, then turns their back and walks without further thought.

source_sentence: 如是如是。
translation: It's thus and so forth.

source_sentence: 其耶輸陀，棄捨革屣亦復如是，步入河渡，爾時彼河水故為淺。
translation: Likewise, that man Yaśodhar discards his leather sandals and steps into the river to cross it, which makes the water shallow.

source_sentence: 「時，耶輸陀善渡河已，至於彼岸，到世尊所。
translation: "After skillfully crossing the river, Yaśodhar reached the other side and went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 而耶輸陀，遙見世尊，威儀整頓，容止可觀，諸根寂靜，心意正定，乃至身以三十二相之所莊嚴，猶如虛空遍滿星宿，見已復生清淨歡喜，生歡喜已，漸到佛所，到佛所已，頂禮佛足，却住一面。
translation: Yesodhar saw the Bhagavān from a distance, his manner was neat and tidy, his demeanor was respectable, his faculties were calm, his mind was correctly concentrated, and his body was adorned with the thirty-two marks, just like the sky filled with stars.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊見耶輸陀却一面已，即便為其次第說法，所謂說於布施之行，持戒之行，復說生天因緣之行，五欲罪患，諸漏未盡，尚有煩惱，讚歎出家清淨之法。
translation: "After seeing him withdrawn to one side, the Bhagavān then proceeded to preach to him in secondary order, explaining the practice of generosity, the practice of observing precepts, the practice of the causes and conditions for birth in heaven, the sins of the five desires, the contaminants that hadn't yet ended, and the afflictions that still remained, and praising the pure Dharma of renunciant monks.

source_sentence: 而世尊知耶輸陀心已生歡喜，已生希有，心得柔軟，心得無礙，堪可受法。
translation: The Bhagavān then knew that Yaśodhar's mind had become joyous, his mind had become desirable, his mind was flexible, and his mind was unimpeded, and he was ready to accept the teaching.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊以佛所有令他喜言，令得道言，而向說法，所謂苦集滅道四諦，向耶輸陀，如是說時，時耶輸陀即於彼坐，遠離塵垢，盡煩惱界。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān addressed Yaśodhar with the words the Buddha had spoken to please others and to make the path attainable, which were the four truths of suffering, arising, cessation, and when he spoke in this way, Yaśodhar sat down there, became free of the dust and defilement, and ended the realm of affliction.

source_sentence: 離煩惱已，於諸法中，生淨法眼，所有結惑，皆滅除盡，如實證知。
translation: After ridding himself of the afflictions, he produces the pure dharma-eye among all things, and all the bonds and afflictions are ceased and removed, which he truly understands.

source_sentence: 譬如淨衣無諸黑縷，入色即受。
translation: It's like a pure robe that has no black threads and is accepted upon entering form.

source_sentence: 如是如是，其耶輸陀善男子心，即於彼坐，遠離塵垢，盡諸煩惱，乃至如實悉皆證知。
translation: Thus and so, that good man Yaśodhar's mind then sits there, free of defilement, ending his afflictions, and truly realizing them all.

source_sentence: 「時，耶輸陀善男子婦，睡眠既覺，於其床上，忽然不見夫耶輸陀。
translation: "Then, after she fell asleep, that good man and his wife suddenly lost sight of their husband Yaśodhar in their bed.

source_sentence: 彼心憶念耶輸陀故，兼復渴仰，思遲戀慕，即便往詣輸陀母邊，到已白言：『聖母！
translation: Being mindful of Yaśodhar, she longed for him, longed for him, and longed for him, so she went to his mother and said, 'Holy mother!

source_sentence: 今知聖母愛子耶輸陀不？
translation: Now, do you know that the Blessed Mother loved her son, Yaśodhar?

source_sentence: 新婦昨夜，眠覺求覓，忽爾不見，不知何去？』
translation: Last night, the bride went to bed looking for her, but suddenly she disappeared; I don't know where she went.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，聖母聞是語已，憐憶愛念耶輸陀故，啼淚懊惱，急疾往詣耶輸陀父大長者邊，到已即白大長者言：『長者！
translation: "After hearing these words, the Blessed Mother, feeling compassionate, remembering, and loving Yehuda, wept and was distressed, and rushed to the great elder Yehuda's father, where she said to him, 'Sir!

source_sentence: 今知仁所愛子耶輸陀不？』
translation: Do you now know that your beloved son Yaśodhar?'

source_sentence: 一一皆如新婦所說。
translation: Each one of them was just as the bride had said.

source_sentence: 「爾時，長者聞其宮中失耶輸陀，以憶念子耶輸陀故，遣使速往智慧人邊，或算師邊，博戲人邊，或婬女家，而告之言：『汝等人輩！
translation: "Then, when the elder heard that he had lost Yaśodhar in his palace, he sent an envoy quickly to a wise man, a master of calculation, a gambler, or a woman's house, and told him, 'You people!

source_sentence: 宜速急疾往如是處求覓我子耶輸陀來。』
translation: You should quickly and hastily go to this place and seek out my son Yaśodhar.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，使者向波羅[木*奈]城四衢道，振鈴而唱，如是告言：『若當有人能向我道見耶輸陀，知耶輸陀所在之處，所行之處，令我得見，令我得聞。
translation: "At the time, the messenger went down the four roads of Pola [munai], rang a bell, and called out, saying, 'Suppose someone could come to me and see Yaśodhar and know where Yaśodhar is and where he's walking, so that I can see and hear him.

source_sentence: 我乞彼人百千價物。』
translation: I'll beg that person for a hundred thousand things.'

source_sentence: 即於後夜，教開城門，遣使疾馳，而遍告言：『汝等城外速疾往求我耶輸陀。』
translation: At the end of the night, he taught them to open the city gates, sent an envoy on a rapid chase, and told them all, 'Go quickly outside the city and seek me, Yaśodhar.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，長者耶輸陀父，當於彼夜天欲曉時，愁憂悵怏，啼哭泣淚，速疾往向跋陀羅提城門之邊，到已即出。
translation: "At the time, the elder Yehuda's father, when it was near dawn that night, was sad and troubled, wept and wept, and quickly went to the city gate of Bhadrati, and left as soon as he arrived.

source_sentence: 漸漸行見其耶輸陀革屣蹤跡，見已尋逐革屣跡行，盡其跡已，於河岸上，見二百千價直革屣，少得本心，即作是念：『我所愛子耶輸陀者，今應不死。』
translation: He gradually walked along and saw the tracks of Yehuda's leather sandals, and after seeing them, he followed their tracks and exhausted them.

source_sentence: 出大喘息，心口念言：『若其身死，此之革屣，久應無有。』
translation: He let out a great gasp and said to himself, 'If he were to die, these leather sandals would not exist for a long time.'

source_sentence: 「時彼長者見革屣已，不觸不緣，棄捨而去。
translation: "Then, when that elder saw the leather slippers, he didn't touch or cognize them, so he discarded them and departed.

source_sentence: 譬如有人，見他涕唾，不觀不念，棄捨而過。
translation: It's like a person who sees another person's tears and spittle, doesn't look at them or think about them, and discards them.

source_sentence: 如是如是，其耶輸陀善男子父，見彼七寶所成一雙革屣，棄捨而過，即便渡彼波羅那河，尋求其子。
translation: Thus and so it was when that good son-father of Yaśodhar's saw a pair of leather sandals made of seven treasures, discarded them, and passed by, and then crossed the Porāna River to seek his son.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊河邊遙見其耶輸陀善男子父向佛而來，世尊見已，作如是念：『此耶輸陀善男子父，既來求子，以愛念故，或能倉卒不避好惡，抱耶輸陀善男子身。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān saw his goodly male father Yesodhar coming toward the Buddha from a distance at the river's edge, and when he saw him, he had this thought, 'This goodly male father Yesodhar came seeking a son, and because of his longing for him, he might have hastily embraced the goodly male body of Yesodhar without avoiding good or evil.

source_sentence: 我今可出變化神通，若作神通變化之事，而耶輸陀善男子父，在於此處，唯得以眼見耶輸陀善男子面，即便停住，勿令相觸。』
translation: Now, I can give rise to my miraculous powers, and if I do something miraculous and transformative while that good man Yesodhar's father is here, I can stop only when I see Yesodhar's face with my eyes and don't let him touch me.'

source_sentence: 「時耶輸陀善男子父，遙見世尊，威儀齊整，端正可喜，乃至譬如虛空中星莊嚴日月，心生歡喜，以歡喜心，往詣佛所。
translation: "When the father of that good man Yaśodhar saw the Bhagavān from a distance, his manner was neat and correct, pleasing, even like the stars in the sky adorned by the sun and moon, his heart became joyous, and with a joyous heart, he went to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 到佛所已，即白佛言：『善哉善哉！
translation: When he arrived at the Buddha's place, he said to him, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 大德沙門，頗見我子耶輸陀者來此以不？』
translation: Venerable monks, have you seen my son Yaśodhar come here?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告彼長者言：『大富長者！
translation: "At that point, the Buddha addressed the elder, saying, 'Great wealthy elder!

source_sentence: 汝若知時，且少安坐，不久當得見耶輸陀。』
translation: If you know this, sit quietly, and soon you will see Yaśodhar.'

source_sentence: 時彼長者作如是念：『此大沙門！
translation: The elder then had this thought, 'This great ascetic!

source_sentence: 應不妄語，所言應實。』
translation: You mustn't lie; what you say should be true.'

source_sentence: 聞此語已，心生歡喜，踊躍充遍，不能自勝，頂禮佛足，却住一面，住一面已。
translation: After hearing those words, his heart rejoiced, he jumped up and down, unable to get over himself, saluted the Buddha's feet, and withdrew to one side, where he stayed.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊即為長者次第方便如應說法，所謂行檀，及結使法悉皆滅已，如實證知。
translation: "At that point, the Bhagavān explained for the elder in turn and with skillful means as it should be explained, saying that the practice donations and the binding dharmas had all ceased and were truly realized.

source_sentence: 譬如淨衣易受染色，如是如是，時彼長者即於彼坐，遠離塵垢，如實證知，於諸法中，得法眼淨，渡煩惱海，越諸鄣礙，無復疑心，到無畏處，不從他聞。
translation: Like pure clothing that's easy to accept and dye, so and so forth, that elder then sat down, became free of the dust and dirt, realized it as it really was, attained purification of the Dharma eye among the teachings, crossed the ocean of affliction, surpassed the hindrances, became free of doubt, reached the fearless place, and didn't hear it from others.

source_sentence: 於世尊邊得聞法教，受佛歸依、受法歸依、受僧歸依，并受五戒。
translation: They hear the teaching of the Dharma from the Bhagavān's side, take refuge in the Buddha, take refuge in the Dharma, take refuge in the saṃgha, and take refuge in the five precepts.

source_sentence: 「爾時，人間彼大長者最在初首，為優婆塞，人身之中以三白成三歸依者，謂耶輸陀善男子父。
translation: "At the time, that great elder among men who was the foremost and first in line was an upāsaka and who among his people had formed the three refugee bonds with the three white ones was called Yaśodhar's good man father.

source_sentence: 其耶輸陀善男子父，於說法時，如是證見，如是觀行，得於道跡，見漏皆盡，一切法中，心得解脫。
translation: When he taught the Dharma, that good son-father Yaśodhar thus realized and thus observed his practice, attained the path's steps, saw that all contaminants were ended, and attained liberation in all things.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊作如是念：『其耶輸陀善男子父，聞法見知，如實漏盡，心得解脫，不應在家受諸五欲，如昔在家。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān had this thought, "That good man Yaśodhar's father heard the teaching and saw it, saw that the contaminants had really ended, and attained liberation, and shouldn't have been at home subject to the five desires as he was at home in the past.

source_sentence: 我今還可攝於神通。』
translation: Now, I can still gather in the psychic powers.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即攝神通，攝神通已，耶輸陀父即於彼坐，得見其子，見已而告耶輸陀言：『子耶輸陀！
translation: After he had collected his supernormal powers, Yesodhar's father sat down and saw his son, and after he saw him, he told Yesodhar, 'Son Yesodhar!

source_sentence: 汝母憶汝受大苦惱，為汝故哭，為汝故悲，莫復為汝而取命終！
translation: Your mother, remembering the great suffering you've endured, weeping and pitying for you, should never again take your life for you!

source_sentence: 汝可至彼與於彼命。』
translation: You may go there and take his life.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，其耶輸陀善男子即觀如來面。
translation: After saying this, that good man Yaśodhar then looked at the Tathāgata's face.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊即便告彼耶輸陀父，作如是言：『汝大長者！
translation: "At that point, the Bhagavān even addressed that father of Yaśodhar and said, 'You great elder!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 若有學人，已學諸智，已學見法，彼聞法時，證知漏盡，心得解脫，彼若迴心入於本家，能更復受五欲以不？』
translation: If there's a student who has learned the cognitions and has learned to see the Dharma and, when he hears the Dharma, realizes that the contaminants have ended and that his mind is liberated, then if he turns his mind back to his original home, will he be able to again experience the five desires and not?'

source_sentence: 長者報言：『不也。
translation: The elder replied, 'No.'

source_sentence: 世尊！』
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊告長者言：『其耶輸陀善男子！
translation: "At that point, the Bhagavān addressed the elder, saying, 'Good man, Yaśodhar!

source_sentence: 今已學智見，證於諸法，如汝無異。
translation: 'Now, having learned the wisdom and vision, I realize the things as you do, no different from you.

source_sentence: 今耶輸陀，聞說法時，證得道跡，諸漏已盡，心淨解脫。』
translation: Now, Yaśodhar, when he heard the teaching, he realized the path, ended the contaminants, and his mind was purified and liberated.'

source_sentence: 佛告長者：『此耶輸陀善男子！
translation: The Buddha told the elder, 'Good boy, this Yaśodhar!

source_sentence: 今不應還歸住於家內受五欲事，如昔在家。』
translation: 'Now, you shouldn't go back to living at home and accepting the five desires as you did at home in the past.'

source_sentence: 爾時長者即白佛言：『善哉！
translation: It was then that the elder said to the Buddha, 'Good!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 耶輸陀今生於人間，善得大利，善生世間，諸漏滅盡，心得解脫。』
translation: Now, Yaśodhar is born among humans, attains great rewards, is well-born in the world, has his contaminants ceased, and attains liberation.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊見耶輸陀善男子身，以諸瓔珞而莊嚴體，即說偈言：「『以諸瓔珞莊嚴身，　　寂定其心證於法，　　調伏諸根悉清淨，　　於諸眾生起大悲。
translation: "Seeing Yaśodhar's body as a good man adorned with jewelry, the Bhagavān then spoke in verse, saying, "Adorned with this body of jewelry, he attains tranquility and concentration in his mind and realizes the Dharma, completely purifies his faculties, and arouses great compassion for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若能如是諦實行，　　是則名為真梵行，　　亦名沙門釋種子，　　是亦名為比丘僧。』
translation: If they can thus truly practice, this is called the true religious practice, which is also called the ascetic, the Śākyamuni, and this is also called a monk.'

source_sentence: 「時耶輸陀善男子父即白佛言：『善哉！
translation: "It was then that Yaśodhar's good father said to the Buddha, 'Good!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願受我請，布施飲食，及耶輸陀善男子等。』
translation: Please accept my invitation to give food and drink, and good sons like Yaśodhar.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於長者邊，嘿然受請，為欲憐愍於長者故。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was at the elder's side, accepting the invitation with reverence, because he wanted to have compassion on the elder.

source_sentence: 「爾時，長者既見世尊嘿然受請，從座而起，頂禮佛足，圍遶三匝，辭佛而去。
translation: "After the Bhagavān calmly accepted his invitation, the elder got up from his seat, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, circled him three times, and left him.

source_sentence: 是時長者去未久間，其耶輸陀大善男子從坐而起，頂禮佛足，胡跪合掌，而白佛言：『善哉！
translation: Not long after the elder's departure, that great good man Yaśodhar rose from his seat, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, knelt down with his palms together, and said to the Buddha, 'Good!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯願世尊！
translation: Venerable Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 與我出家，受具足戒。』
translation: Leave home with me and receive the full set of precepts.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告耶輸陀言：『善來比丘！
translation: "It was then that the Buddha addressed Yaśodhar, saying, 'Well done, monks!

source_sentence: 汝今於我所說法中，行於梵行，正盡諸漏。』
translation: Now, in the teaching I've given you, you're carrying out the religious practice and are correctly ending the contaminants.'

source_sentence: 佛說是已，時其長老耶輸陀身，即成出家，得具足戒，為大沙門。
translation: After the Buddha said this, the elder Yaśodhar himself became a renunciant, attained the full set of precepts, and became a great ascetic.

source_sentence: 當於是時，此世間中，七阿羅漢：一是世尊，及五比丘、耶輸陀等。
translation: At the time, there were seven arhats in the world: one was the Bhagavān, five monks, Yaśodhar, and so forth.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊於晨朝時，著衣持鉢，命耶輸陀用為侍者，向其父家。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān put on his robe and took his bowl in the morning and ordered Yaśodhar to serve as an attendant as he headed for his father's house.

source_sentence: 到彼家已，鋪座而坐。
translation: When he arrived at his father's house, he spread out his seat and sat down.

source_sentence: 是時長老耶輸陀母，并及長老耶輸陀婦，來向佛邊，到佛所已，頂禮佛足，却坐一面，退一面已。
translation: The elder Yaśodhar's mother and the elder Yaśodhar's wife came to the Buddha, paid homage to his feet when they arrived, withdrew to sit at one side, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 世尊次第而為說法，所謂如是說布施行，乃至清淨，如來悉知彼等一切，心生歡喜清淨柔軟，心無障礙。
translation: The Bhagavān then explained the teaching in order, describing it as thus explained and disseminated, up to its purity, and the Tathāgata knew them all, rejoiced, was pure and gentle, and had no mental obstruction.

source_sentence: 「爾時世尊，所有諸佛令歡喜法，所謂苦諦，及苦集諦，苦滅得道，世尊為彼說是法時，彼等於坐，遠離諸塵，得清淨智，煩惱界盡，於諸法中，得淨法眼。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān, all the buddhas made happy the teaching that refers to the truth of suffering, the truth of suffering's accumulation, and the path to the cessation of suffering, and when the Bhagavān explained this teaching to them, they sat down, became free of the dust, attained pure knowledge, ended the realm of affliction, and attained the pure eye of the Dharma among all dharmas.

source_sentence: 所有垢法，諸可滅法，一切知已，皆悉滅盡，如實證知。
translation: After knowing all the defiled things and things that can be destroyed, they all completely cease and truly realize them.

source_sentence: 譬如淨衣無有垢膩，隨所染入，而受其色。
translation: It's like a pure robe that has no dirt or grime, and you accept its color as it's defiled.

source_sentence: 如是如是，彼等眷屬，坐於彼座，遠離塵垢，所有垢法，皆悉滅已，如實證知。
translation: Thus and so, those members of their retinue sitting on that seat are free of dirt and grime, and they truly know that all the defiling qualities have been completely ceased.

source_sentence: 彼等婦人，既見諸法，得證深入，到諸法邊，渡煩惱壙，得無疑畏，不從他人說法聽證。
translation: Those women, having seen the things, attained deep realization, went to the limits of the things, crossed the coffin of affliction, became fearless, and didn't listen to or hear the teaching from others.

source_sentence: 世尊教中，得知見已，歸依佛、法及歸依僧，即受五戒。
translation: The Bhagavān teaches that after knowing and seeing them, they must take refuge in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha, and then accept the five precepts.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世間當於是日，最初人中三歸受戒，先得成為優婆夷者，所謂長老耶輸陀母，并及長老耶輸陀婦，所有一切諸眷屬等。
translation: "At that point, it will be the first among people in the world to accept the precepts in three ways and become an upāsikā, which is called the elder Yaśodhar's mother, the elder Yaśodhar's wife, and all their dependents.

source_sentence: 「爾時，善覺大富長者，既聞世尊為其眷屬如應說法，聞已歡喜，即起辦食。
translation: "At the time, the well-enlightened, wealthy elder rejoiced when he heard the Bhagavān teach his followers as he should have done, and he got up to serve food.

source_sentence: 長者及妻，并其新婦，自手將好種種美食，奉供養佛及耶輸陀。
translation: The elder, his wife, and their bride prepared a variety of delicious foods with their own hands and offered them to the Buddha and Yaśodhar.

source_sentence: 所謂舐[口*束]咋噉[口*尃]唼，其所施食，悉皆充足，恣意飽食。
translation: They called them licking [mouth*bunch] and gnawing [mouth*latest], and all of the food they gave was plentiful, so they ate it freely.

source_sentence: 「爾時，長老耶輸陀父善覺、長者婦及新婦，見佛食訖收衣攝鉢，洗於手足，如是清淨安坐竟已，人別各自將一小鋪，次第相隨來向佛前依大小坐。
translation: "At the time, the elder Yaśodhar's father Sunjaku, the elder woman, and the bride saw the Buddha finish eating, put away their robes and bowls, wash their hands and feet, and finish sitting down in this way, then they each took a small bunk and followed one another to sit in order in front of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊既見善覺長者眷屬如法而來坐於前已，如來慈愍，為欲度脫使離苦惱，是故為其如應說法。
translation: After the Bhagavān saw the well-enlightened elder's retinue sitting in front of him according to the teaching, the Tathāgata compassionately wanted to liberate them from suffering and distress, so he spoke to them as he should.

source_sentence: 彼聞法已，心生歡喜，信心熾盛，威德增上。
translation: After hearing the teaching, their hearts rejoiced, their faith flourished, and their authority increased.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼等既聽法已，乃至一切心生歡喜，如是知已。
translation: At that point, after listening to the teaching, they rejoiced in their hearts up to their very core and knew it that way.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即從坐起，其耶輸陀即隨佛行。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān rose from his seat, and he, Yaśodhar, followed the Buddha's lead.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第三十五
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 35
